# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length.(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Hello there! This is a very long string that I want to wrap into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
# Output:
# Hello there!
# This is a very
# long string that
# I want to wrap
# into multiple
# lines.
```
